section.title: How To - Set Hotkeys for Keyman, Keyman Keyboards and Windows Languages
section.para: A hotkey is a keyboard shortcut. In Keyman these are used to turn on and off Keyman functions, Keyman keyboards and Windows languages.
To set the hotkey for a Keyman function, Keyman keyboard or Windows language:

listitem.para: Open Keyman Configuration, from the Keyman menu in the Windows taskbar.
Click the hotkey link beside the function, keyboard or language. The Change Hotkey dialog box will be displayed.
Select a default hotkey or click Custom and type the hotkey you wish to use.

note.para: If you press a single letter or Shift plus a single letter, the hotkey will default to Ctrl + Alt plus the letter you pressed, in order to avoid conflicts with standard keyboard input.
To clear a hotkey that has been set previously, click Clear Hotkey or press Backspace.
Be aware that you can set the hotkey to replace common Windows hotkeys (Ctrl + C, Ctrl + V, etc).

listitem.para: Click OK to save your selection.
Click OK again from the Configuration window to apply the changes.

section.para: The new hotkey will now be available.
